00105 
00108 void ec_master_init_static(void)
00109 {
00110 #ifdef EC_HAVE_CYCLES
00111     timeout_cycles = (cycles_t) EC_IO_TIMEOUT /* us */ * (cpu_khz / 1000);
00112     ext_injection_timeout_cycles =
00113         (cycles_t) EC_SDO_INJECTION_TIMEOUT /* us */ * (cpu_khz / 1000);
00114 #else
00115     // one jiffy may always elapse between time measurement
00116     timeout_jiffies = max(EC_IO_TIMEOUT * HZ / 1000000, 1);
00117     ext_injection_timeout_jiffies =
00118         max(EC_SDO_INJECTION_TIMEOUT * HZ / 1000000, 1);
00119 #endif
00120 }
00121 
00122 /*****************************************************************************/
00123 
00129 int ec_master_init(ec_master_t *master, 
00130         unsigned int index, 
00131         const uint8_t *main_mac, 
00132         const uint8_t *backup_mac, 
00133         dev_t device_number, 
00134         struct class *class, 
00135         unsigned int debug_level 
00136         )
00137 {
00138     int ret;
00139     unsigned int dev_idx, i;
00140 
00141     master->index = index;
00142     master->reserved = 0;
00143 
00144     sema_init(&master->master_sem, 1);
00145 
00146     for (dev_idx = EC_DEVICE_MAIN; dev_idx < EC_MAX_NUM_DEVICES; dev_idx++) {
00147         master->macs[dev_idx] = NULL;
00148     }
00149 
00150     master->macs[EC_DEVICE_MAIN] = main_mac;
00151 
00152 #if EC_MAX_NUM_DEVICES > 1
00153     master->macs[EC_DEVICE_BACKUP] = backup_mac;
00154     master->num_devices = 1 + !ec_mac_is_zero(backup_mac);
00155 #else
00156     if (!ec_mac_is_zero(backup_mac)) {
00157         EC_MASTER_WARN(master, "Ignoring backup MAC address!");
00158     }
00159 #endif
00160 
00161     ec_master_clear_device_stats(master);
00162 
00163     sema_init(&master->device_sem, 1);
00164 
00165     master->phase = EC_ORPHANED;
00166     master->active = 0;
00167     master->config_changed = 0;
00168     master->injection_seq_fsm = 0;
00169     master->injection_seq_rt = 0;
00170 
00171     master->slaves = NULL;
00172     master->slave_count = 0;
00173 
00174     INIT_LIST_HEAD(&master->configs);
00175     INIT_LIST_HEAD(&master->domains);
00176 
00177     master->app_time = 0ULL;
00178     master->app_start_time = 0ULL;
00179     master->has_app_time = 0;
00180 
00181     master->scan_busy = 0;
00182     master->allow_scan = 1;
00183     sema_init(&master->scan_sem, 1);
00184     init_waitqueue_head(&master->scan_queue);
00185 
00186     master->config_busy = 0;
00187     sema_init(&master->config_sem, 1);
00188     init_waitqueue_head(&master->config_queue);
00189 
00190     INIT_LIST_HEAD(&master->datagram_queue);
00191     master->datagram_index = 0;
00192 
00193     INIT_LIST_HEAD(&master->ext_datagram_queue);
00194     sema_init(&master->ext_queue_sem, 1);
00195 
00196     master->ext_ring_idx_rt = 0;
00197     master->ext_ring_idx_fsm = 0;
00198 
00199     // init external datagram ring
00200     for (i = 0; i < EC_EXT_RING_SIZE; i++) {
00201         ec_datagram_t *datagram = &master->ext_datagram_ring[i];
00202         ec_datagram_init(datagram);
00203         snprintf(datagram->name, EC_DATAGRAM_NAME_SIZE, "ext-%u", i);
00204     }
00205 
00206     // send interval in IDLE phase
00207     ec_master_set_send_interval(master, 1000000 / HZ);
00208 
00209     master->fsm_slave = NULL;
00210     INIT_LIST_HEAD(&master->fsm_exec_list);
00211     master->fsm_exec_count = 0U;
00212 
00213     master->debug_level = debug_level;
00214     master->stats.timeouts = 0;
00215     master->stats.corrupted = 0;
00216     master->stats.unmatched = 0;
00217     master->stats.output_jiffies = 0;
00218 
00219     master->thread = NULL;
00220 
00221 #ifdef EC_EOE
00222     master->eoe_thread = NULL;
00223     INIT_LIST_HEAD(&master->eoe_handlers);
00224 #endif
00225 
00226     sema_init(&master->io_sem, 1);
00227     master->send_cb = NULL;
00228     master->receive_cb = NULL;
00229     master->cb_data = NULL;
00230     master->app_send_cb = NULL;
00231     master->app_receive_cb = NULL;
00232     master->app_cb_data = NULL;
00233 
00234     INIT_LIST_HEAD(&master->sii_requests);
00235 
00236     init_waitqueue_head(&master->request_queue);
00237 
00238     // init devices
00239     for (dev_idx = EC_DEVICE_MAIN; dev_idx < ec_master_num_devices(master);
00240             dev_idx++) {
00241         ret = ec_device_init(&master->devices[dev_idx], master);
00242         if (ret < 0) {
00243             goto out_clear_devices;
00244         }
00245     }
00246 
00247     // init state machine datagram
00248     ec_datagram_init(&master->fsm_datagram);
00249     snprintf(master->fsm_datagram.name, EC_DATAGRAM_NAME_SIZE, "master-fsm");
00250     ret = ec_datagram_prealloc(&master->fsm_datagram, EC_MAX_DATA_SIZE);
00251     if (ret < 0) {
00252         ec_datagram_clear(&master->fsm_datagram);
00253         EC_MASTER_ERR(master, "Failed to allocate FSM datagram.\n");
00254         goto out_clear_devices;
00255     }
00256 
00257     // create state machine object
00258     ec_fsm_master_init(&master->fsm, master, &master->fsm_datagram);
00259 
00260     // alloc external datagram ring
00261     for (i = 0; i < EC_EXT_RING_SIZE; i++) {
00262         ec_datagram_t *datagram = &master->ext_datagram_ring[i];
00263         ret = ec_datagram_prealloc(datagram, EC_MAX_DATA_SIZE);
00264         if (ret) {
00265             EC_MASTER_ERR(master, "Failed to allocate external"
00266                     " datagram %u.\n", i);
00267             goto out_clear_ext_datagrams;
00268         }
00269     }
00270 
00271     // init reference sync datagram
00272     ec_datagram_init(&master->ref_sync_datagram);
00273     snprintf(master->ref_sync_datagram.name, EC_DATAGRAM_NAME_SIZE,
00274             "refsync");
00275     ret = ec_datagram_prealloc(&master->ref_sync_datagram, 4);
00276     if (ret < 0) {
00277         ec_datagram_clear(&master->ref_sync_datagram);
00278         EC_MASTER_ERR(master, "Failed to allocate reference"
00279                 " synchronisation datagram.\n");
00280         goto out_clear_ext_datagrams;
00281     }
00282 
00283     // init sync datagram
00284     ec_datagram_init(&master->sync_datagram);
00285     snprintf(master->sync_datagram.name, EC_DATAGRAM_NAME_SIZE, "sync");
00286     ret = ec_datagram_prealloc(&master->sync_datagram, 4);
00287     if (ret < 0) {
00288         ec_datagram_clear(&master->sync_datagram);
00289         EC_MASTER_ERR(master, "Failed to allocate"
00290                 " synchronisation datagram.\n");
00291         goto out_clear_ref_sync;
00292     }
00293 
00294     // init sync monitor datagram
00295     ec_datagram_init(&master->sync_mon_datagram);
00296     snprintf(master->sync_mon_datagram.name, EC_DATAGRAM_NAME_SIZE,
00297             "syncmon");
00298     ret = ec_datagram_brd(&master->sync_mon_datagram, 0x092c, 4);
00299     if (ret < 0) {
00300         ec_datagram_clear(&master->sync_mon_datagram);
00301         EC_MASTER_ERR(master, "Failed to allocate sync"
00302                 " monitoring datagram.\n");
00303         goto out_clear_sync;
00304     }
00305 
00306     master->dc_ref_config = NULL;
00307     master->dc_ref_clock = NULL;
00308 
00309     // init character device
00310     ret = ec_cdev_init(&master->cdev, master, device_number);
00311     if (ret)
00312         goto out_clear_sync_mon;
00313 
00314 #if LINUX_VERSION_CODE >= KERNEL_VERSION(2, 6, 27)
00315     master->class_device = device_create(class, NULL,
00316             MKDEV(MAJOR(device_number), master->index), NULL,
00317             "EtherCAT%u", master->index);
00318 #elif LINUX_VERSION_CODE >= KERNEL_VERSION(2, 6, 26)
00319     master->class_device = device_create(class, NULL,
00320             MKDEV(MAJOR(device_number), master->index),
00321             "EtherCAT%u", master->index);
00322 #elif LINUX_VERSION_CODE >= KERNEL_VERSION(2, 6, 15)
00323     master->class_device = class_device_create(class, NULL,
00324             MKDEV(MAJOR(device_number), master->index), NULL,
00325             "EtherCAT%u", master->index);
00326 #else
00327     master->class_device = class_device_create(class,
00328             MKDEV(MAJOR(device_number), master->index), NULL,
00329             "EtherCAT%u", master->index);
00330 #endif
00331     if (IS_ERR(master->class_device)) {
00332         EC_MASTER_ERR(master, "Failed to create class device!\n");
00333         ret = PTR_ERR(master->class_device);
00334         goto out_clear_cdev;
00335     }
00336 
00337 #ifdef EC_RTDM
00338     // init RTDM device
00339     ret = ec_rtdm_dev_init(&master->rtdm_dev, master);
00340     if (ret) {
00341         goto out_unregister_class_device;
00342     }
00343 #endif
00344 
00345     return 0;
00346 
00347 #ifdef EC_RTDM
00348 out_unregister_class_device:
00349 #if LINUX_VERSION_CODE >= KERNEL_VERSION(2, 6, 26)
00350     device_unregister(master->class_device);
00351 #else
00352     class_device_unregister(master->class_device);
00353 #endif
00354 #endif
00355 out_clear_cdev:
00356     ec_cdev_clear(&master->cdev);
00357 out_clear_sync_mon:
00358     ec_datagram_clear(&master->sync_mon_datagram);
00359 out_clear_sync:
00360     ec_datagram_clear(&master->sync_datagram);
00361 out_clear_ref_sync:
00362     ec_datagram_clear(&master->ref_sync_datagram);
00363 out_clear_ext_datagrams:
00364     for (i = 0; i < EC_EXT_RING_SIZE; i++) {
00365         ec_datagram_clear(&master->ext_datagram_ring[i]);
00366     }
00367     ec_fsm_master_clear(&master->fsm);
00368     ec_datagram_clear(&master->fsm_datagram);
00369 out_clear_devices:
00370     for (; dev_idx > 0; dev_idx--) {
00371         ec_device_clear(&master->devices[dev_idx - 1]);
00372     }
00373     return ret;
00374 }
00375 
00376 /*****************************************************************************/
00377 
00380 void ec_master_clear(
00381         ec_master_t *master 
00382         )
00383 {
00384     unsigned int dev_idx, i;
00385 
00386 #ifdef EC_RTDM
00387     ec_rtdm_dev_clear(&master->rtdm_dev);
00388 #endif
00389 
00390 #if LINUX_VERSION_CODE >= KERNEL_VERSION(2, 6, 26)
00391     device_unregister(master->class_device);
00392 #else
00393     class_device_unregister(master->class_device);
00394 #endif
00395 
00396     ec_cdev_clear(&master->cdev);
00397 
00398 #ifdef EC_EOE
00399     ec_master_clear_eoe_handlers(master);
00400 #endif
00401     ec_master_clear_domains(master);
00402     ec_master_clear_slave_configs(master);
00403     ec_master_clear_slaves(master);
00404 
00405     ec_datagram_clear(&master->sync_mon_datagram);
00406     ec_datagram_clear(&master->sync_datagram);
00407     ec_datagram_clear(&master->ref_sync_datagram);
00408 
00409     for (i = 0; i < EC_EXT_RING_SIZE; i++) {
00410         ec_datagram_clear(&master->ext_datagram_ring[i]);
00411     }
00412 
00413     ec_fsm_master_clear(&master->fsm);
00414     ec_datagram_clear(&master->fsm_datagram);
00415 
00416     for (dev_idx = EC_DEVICE_MAIN; dev_idx < ec_master_num_devices(master);
00417             dev_idx++) {
00418         ec_device_clear(&master->devices[dev_idx]);
00419     }
00420 }

00424 #ifdef EC_EOE
00425 
00427 void ec_master_clear_eoe_handlers(
00428         ec_master_t *master 
00429         )
00430 {
00431     ec_eoe_t *eoe, *next;
00432 
00433     list_for_each_entry_safe(eoe, next, &master->eoe_handlers, list) {
00434         list_del(&eoe->list);
00435         ec_eoe_clear(eoe);
00436         kfree(eoe);
00437     }
00438 }
00439 #endif
00440 
00441 /*****************************************************************************/
00442 
00445 void ec_master_clear_slave_configs(ec_master_t *master)
00446 {
00447     ec_slave_config_t *sc, *next;
00448 
00449     master->dc_ref_config = NULL;
00450     master->fsm.sdo_request = NULL; // mark sdo_request as invalid
00451 
00452     list_for_each_entry_safe(sc, next, &master->configs, list) {
00453         list_del(&sc->list);
00454         ec_slave_config_clear(sc);
00455         kfree(sc);
00456     }
00457 }
00458 
00459 /*****************************************************************************/
00460 
00463 void ec_master_clear_slaves(ec_master_t *master)
00464 {
00465     ec_slave_t *slave;
00466 
00467     master->dc_ref_clock = NULL;
00468 
00469     // External requests are obsolete, so we wake pending waiters and remove
00470     // them from the list.
00471 
00472     while (!list_empty(&master->sii_requests)) {
00473         ec_sii_write_request_t *request =
00474             list_entry(master->sii_requests.next,
00475                     ec_sii_write_request_t, list);
00476         list_del_init(&request->list); // dequeue
00477         EC_MASTER_WARN(master, "Discarding SII request, slave %u about"
00478                 " to be deleted.\n", request->slave->ring_position);
00479         request->state = EC_INT_REQUEST_FAILURE;
00480         wake_up_all(&master->request_queue);
00481     }
00482 
00483     master->fsm_slave = NULL;
00484     INIT_LIST_HEAD(&master->fsm_exec_list);
00485     master->fsm_exec_count = 0;
00486 
00487     for (slave = master->slaves;
00488             slave < master->slaves + master->slave_count;
00489             slave++) {
00490         ec_slave_clear(slave);
00491     }
00492 
00493     if (master->slaves) {
00494         kfree(master->slaves);
00495         master->slaves = NULL;
00496     }
00497 
00498     master->slave_count = 0;
00499 }
00500 
00501 /*****************************************************************************/
00502 
00505 void ec_master_clear_domains(ec_master_t *master)
00506 {
00507     ec_domain_t *domain, *next;
00508 
00509     list_for_each_entry_safe(domain, next, &master->domains, list) {
00510         list_del(&domain->list);
00511         ec_domain_clear(domain);
00512         kfree(domain);
00513     }
00514 }
00515

00520 void ec_master_clear_config(
00521         ec_master_t *master 
00522         )
00523 {
00524     down(&master->master_sem);
00525     ec_master_clear_domains(master);
00526     ec_master_clear_slave_configs(master);
00527     up(&master->master_sem);
00528 }

00555     up(&master->io_sem);
00556 }

00558 /*****************************************************************************/
00559 
00565 int ec_master_thread_start(
00566         ec_master_t *master, 
00567         int (*thread_func)(void *), 
00568         const char *name 
00569         )
00570 {
00571     EC_MASTER_INFO(master, "Starting %s thread.\n", name);
00572     master->thread = kthread_run(thread_func, master, name);
00573     if (IS_ERR(master->thread)) {
00574         int err = (int) PTR_ERR(master->thread);
00575         EC_MASTER_ERR(master, "Failed to start master thread (error %i)!\n",
00576                 err);
00577         master->thread = NULL;
00578         return err;
00579     }
00580 
00581     return 0;
00582 }
00583 
00584 /*****************************************************************************/
00585 
00588 void ec_master_thread_stop(
00589         ec_master_t *master 
00590         )
00591 {
00592     unsigned long sleep_jiffies;
00593 
00594     if (!master->thread) {
00595         EC_MASTER_WARN(master, "%s(): Already finished!\n", __func__);
00596         return;
00597     }
00598 
00599     EC_MASTER_DBG(master, 1, "Stopping master thread.\n");
00600 
00601     kthread_stop(master->thread);
00602     master->thread = NULL;
00603     EC_MASTER_INFO(master, "Master thread exited.\n");
00604 
00605     if (master->fsm_datagram.state != EC_DATAGRAM_SENT) {
00606         return;
00607     }
00608 
00609     // wait for FSM datagram
00610     sleep_jiffies = max(HZ / 100, 1); // 10 ms, at least 1 jiffy
00611     schedule_timeout(sleep_jiffies);
00612 }
00613 
00614 /*****************************************************************************/
00615 
00620 int ec_master_enter_idle_phase(
00621         ec_master_t *master 
00622         )
00623 {
00624     int ret;
00625     ec_device_index_t dev_idx;
00626 
00627     EC_MASTER_DBG(master, 1, "ORPHANED -> IDLE.\n");
00628 
00629     master->send_cb = ec_master_internal_send_cb;
00630     master->receive_cb = ec_master_internal_receive_cb;
00631     master->cb_data = master;
00632 
00633     master->phase = EC_IDLE;
00634 
00635     // reset number of responding slaves to trigger scanning
00636     for (dev_idx = EC_DEVICE_MAIN; dev_idx < ec_master_num_devices(master);
00637             dev_idx++) {
00638         master->fsm.slaves_responding[dev_idx] = 0;
00639     }
00640 
00641     ret = ec_master_thread_start(master, ec_master_idle_thread,
00642             "EtherCAT-IDLE");
00643     if (ret)
00644         master->phase = EC_ORPHANED;
00645 
00646     return ret;
00647 }
00648 
00649 /*****************************************************************************/
00650 
00653 void ec_master_leave_idle_phase(ec_master_t *master )
00654 {
00655     EC_MASTER_DBG(master, 1, "IDLE -> ORPHANED.\n");
00656 
00657     master->phase = EC_ORPHANED;
00658 
00659 #ifdef EC_EOE
00660     ec_master_eoe_stop(master);
00661 #endif
00662     ec_master_thread_stop(master);
00663 
00664     down(&master->master_sem);
00665     ec_master_clear_slaves(master);
00666     up(&master->master_sem);
00667 
00668     ec_fsm_master_reset(&master->fsm);
00669 }
00670 
00671 /*****************************************************************************/
00672 
00677 int ec_master_enter_operation_phase(
00678         ec_master_t *master 
00679         )
00680 {
00681     int ret = 0;
00682     ec_slave_t *slave;
00683 #ifdef EC_EOE
00684     ec_eoe_t *eoe;
00685 #endif
00686 
00687     EC_MASTER_DBG(master, 1, "IDLE -> OPERATION.\n");
00688 
00689     down(&master->config_sem);
00690     if (master->config_busy) {
00691         up(&master->config_sem);
00692 
00693         // wait for slave configuration to complete
00694         ret = wait_event_interruptible(master->config_queue,
00695                     !master->config_busy);
00696         if (ret) {
00697             EC_MASTER_INFO(master, "Finishing slave configuration"
00698                     " interrupted by signal.\n");
00699             goto out_return;
00700         }
00701 
00702         EC_MASTER_DBG(master, 1, "Waiting for pending slave"
00703                 " configuration returned.\n");
00704     } else {
00705         up(&master->config_sem);
00706     }
00707 
00708     down(&master->scan_sem);
00709     master->allow_scan = 0; // 'lock' the slave list
00710     if (!master->scan_busy) {
00711         up(&master->scan_sem);
00712     } else {
00713         up(&master->scan_sem);
00714 
00715         // wait for slave scan to complete
00716         ret = wait_event_interruptible(master->scan_queue,
00717                 !master->scan_busy);
00718         if (ret) {
00719             EC_MASTER_INFO(master, "Waiting for slave scan"
00720                     " interrupted by signal.\n");
00721             goto out_allow;
00722         }
00723 
00724         EC_MASTER_DBG(master, 1, "Waiting for pending"
00725                 " slave scan returned.\n");
00726     }
00727 
00728     // set states for all slaves
00729     for (slave = master->slaves;
00730             slave < master->slaves + master->slave_count;
00731             slave++) {
00732         ec_slave_request_state(slave, EC_SLAVE_STATE_PREOP);
00733     }
00734 
00735 #ifdef EC_EOE
00736     // ... but set EoE slaves to OP
00737     list_for_each_entry(eoe, &master->eoe_handlers, list) {
00738         if (ec_eoe_is_open(eoe))
00739             ec_slave_request_state(eoe->slave, EC_SLAVE_STATE_OP);
00740     }
00741 #endif
00742 
00743     master->phase = EC_OPERATION;
00744     master->app_send_cb = NULL;
00745     master->app_receive_cb = NULL;
00746     master->app_cb_data = NULL;
00747     return ret;
00748 
00749 out_allow:
00750     master->allow_scan = 1;
00751 out_return:
00752     return ret;
00753 }
00754 
00755 /*****************************************************************************/
00756 
00759 void ec_master_leave_operation_phase(
00760         ec_master_t *master 
00761         )
00762 {
00763     if (master->active) {
00764         ecrt_master_deactivate(master); // also clears config
00765     } else {
00766         ec_master_clear_config(master);
00767     }
00768 
00769     /* Re-allow scanning for IDLE phase. */
00770     master->allow_scan = 1;
00771 
00772     EC_MASTER_DBG(master, 1, "OPERATION -> IDLE.\n");
00773 
00774     master->phase = EC_IDLE;
00775 }
00776 
00777 /*****************************************************************************/
00778 
00781 void ec_master_inject_external_datagrams(
00782         ec_master_t *master 
00783         )
00784 {
00785     ec_datagram_t *datagram;
00786     size_t queue_size = 0, new_queue_size = 0;
00787 #if DEBUG_INJECT
00788     unsigned int datagram_count = 0;
00789 #endif
00790 
00791     if (master->ext_ring_idx_rt == master->ext_ring_idx_fsm) {
00792         // nothing to inject
00793         return;
00794     }
00795 
00796     list_for_each_entry(datagram, &master->datagram_queue, queue) {
00797         if (datagram->state == EC_DATAGRAM_QUEUED) {
00798             queue_size += datagram->data_size;
00799         }
00800     }
00801 
00802 #if DEBUG_INJECT
00803     EC_MASTER_DBG(master, 1, "Injecting datagrams, queue_size=%zu\n",
00804             queue_size);
00805 #endif
00806 
00807     while (master->ext_ring_idx_rt != master->ext_ring_idx_fsm) {
00808         datagram = &master->ext_datagram_ring[master->ext_ring_idx_rt];
00809 
00810         if (datagram->state != EC_DATAGRAM_INIT) {
00811             // skip datagram
00812             master->ext_ring_idx_rt =
00813                 (master->ext_ring_idx_rt + 1) % EC_EXT_RING_SIZE;
00814             continue;
00815         }
00816 
00817         new_queue_size = queue_size + datagram->data_size;
00818         if (new_queue_size <= master->max_queue_size) {
00819 #if DEBUG_INJECT
00820             EC_MASTER_DBG(master, 1, "Injecting datagram %s"
00821                     " size=%zu, queue_size=%zu\n", datagram->name,
00822                     datagram->data_size, new_queue_size);
00823             datagram_count++;
00824 #endif
00825 #ifdef EC_HAVE_CYCLES
00826             datagram->cycles_sent = 0;
00827 #endif
00828             datagram->jiffies_sent = 0;
00829             ec_master_queue_datagram(master, datagram);
00830             queue_size = new_queue_size;
00831         }
00832         else if (datagram->data_size > master->max_queue_size) {
00833             datagram->state = EC_DATAGRAM_ERROR;
00834             EC_MASTER_ERR(master, "External datagram %s is too large,"
00835                     " size=%zu, max_queue_size=%zu\n",
00836                     datagram->name, datagram->data_size,
00837                     master->max_queue_size);
00838         }
00839         else { // datagram does not fit in the current cycle
00840 #ifdef EC_HAVE_CYCLES
00841             cycles_t cycles_now = get_cycles();
00842 
00843             if (cycles_now - datagram->cycles_sent
00844                     > ext_injection_timeout_cycles)
00845 #else
00846             if (jiffies - datagram->jiffies_sent
00847                     > ext_injection_timeout_jiffies)
00848 #endif
00849             {
00850                 unsigned int time_us;
00851 
00852                 datagram->state = EC_DATAGRAM_ERROR;
00853 #ifdef EC_HAVE_CYCLES
00854                 time_us = (unsigned int)
00855                     ((cycles_now - datagram->cycles_sent) * 1000LL)
00856                     / cpu_khz;
00857 #else
00858                 time_us = (unsigned int)
00859                     ((jiffies - datagram->jiffies_sent) * 1000000 / HZ);
00860 #endif
00861                 EC_MASTER_ERR(master, "Timeout %u us: Injecting"
00862                         " external datagram %s size=%zu,"
00863                         " max_queue_size=%zu\n", time_us, datagram->name,
00864                         datagram->data_size, master->max_queue_size);
00865             }
00866             else {
00867 #if DEBUG_INJECT
00868                 EC_MASTER_DBG(master, 1, "Deferred injecting"
00869                         " external datagram %s size=%u, queue_size=%u\n",
00870                         datagram->name, datagram->data_size, queue_size);
00871 #endif
00872                 break;
00873             }
00874         }
00875 
00876         master->ext_ring_idx_rt =
00877             (master->ext_ring_idx_rt + 1) % EC_EXT_RING_SIZE;
00878     }
00879 
00880 #if DEBUG_INJECT
00881     EC_MASTER_DBG(master, 1, "Injected %u datagrams.\n", datagram_count);
00882 #endif
00883 }
00884 
00885 /*****************************************************************************/
00886 
00890 void ec_master_set_send_interval(
00891         ec_master_t *master, 
00892         unsigned int send_interval 
00893         )
00894 {
00895     master->send_interval = send_interval;
00896     master->max_queue_size =
00897         (send_interval * 1000) / EC_BYTE_TRANSMISSION_TIME_NS;
00898     master->max_queue_size -= master->max_queue_size / 10;
00899 }
00900 
00901 /*****************************************************************************/
00902 
00907 ec_datagram_t *ec_master_get_external_datagram(
00908         ec_master_t *master 
00909         )
00910 {
00911     if ((master->ext_ring_idx_fsm + 1) % EC_EXT_RING_SIZE !=
00912             master->ext_ring_idx_rt) {
00913         ec_datagram_t *datagram =
00914             &master->ext_datagram_ring[master->ext_ring_idx_fsm];
00915         return datagram;
00916     }
00917     else {
00918         return NULL;
00919     }
00920 }
00921 
00922 /*****************************************************************************/
00923 
00926 void ec_master_queue_datagram(
00927         ec_master_t *master, 
00928         ec_datagram_t *datagram 
00929         )
00930 {
00931     ec_datagram_t *queued_datagram;
00932 
00933     /* It is possible, that a datagram in the queue is re-initialized with the
00934      * ec_datagram_<type>() methods and then shall be queued with this method.
00935      * In that case, the state is already reset to EC_DATAGRAM_INIT. Check if
00936      * the datagram is queued to avoid duplicate queuing (which results in an
00937      * infinite loop!). Set the state to EC_DATAGRAM_QUEUED again, probably
00938      * causing an unmatched datagram. */
00939     list_for_each_entry(queued_datagram, &master->datagram_queue, queue) {
00940         if (queued_datagram == datagram) {
00941             datagram->skip_count++;
00942             EC_MASTER_DBG(master, 1,
00943                     "Datagram %p already queued (skipping).\n", datagram);
00944             datagram->state = EC_DATAGRAM_QUEUED;
00945             return;
00946         }
00947     }
00948 
00949     list_add_tail(&datagram->queue, &master->datagram_queue);
00950     datagram->state = EC_DATAGRAM_QUEUED;
00951 }
00952 
00953 /*****************************************************************************/
00954 
00957 void ec_master_queue_datagram_ext(
00958         ec_master_t *master, 
00959         ec_datagram_t *datagram 
00960         )
00961 {
00962     down(&master->ext_queue_sem);
00963     list_add_tail(&datagram->queue, &master->ext_datagram_queue);
00964     up(&master->ext_queue_sem);
00965 }
00966 
00967 /*****************************************************************************/
00968 
00972 void ec_master_send_datagrams(
00973         ec_master_t *master, 
00974         ec_device_index_t device_index 
00975         )
00976 {
00977     ec_datagram_t *datagram, *next;
00978     size_t datagram_size;
00979     uint8_t *frame_data, *cur_data = NULL;
00980     void *follows_word;
00981 #ifdef EC_HAVE_CYCLES
00982     cycles_t cycles_start, cycles_sent, cycles_end;
00983 #endif
00984     unsigned long jiffies_sent;
00985     unsigned int frame_count, more_datagrams_waiting;
00986     struct list_head sent_datagrams;
00987 
00988 #ifdef EC_HAVE_CYCLES
00989     cycles_start = get_cycles();
00990 #endif
00991     frame_count = 0;
00992     INIT_LIST_HEAD(&sent_datagrams);
00993 
00994     EC_MASTER_DBG(master, 2, "%s(device_index = %u)\n",
00995             __func__, device_index);
00996 
00997     do {
00998         frame_data = NULL;
00999         follows_word = NULL;
01000         more_datagrams_waiting = 0;
01001 
01002         // fill current frame with datagrams
01003         list_for_each_entry(datagram, &master->datagram_queue, queue) {
01004             if (datagram->state != EC_DATAGRAM_QUEUED ||
01005                     datagram->device_index != device_index) {
01006                 continue;
01007             }
01008 
01009             if (!frame_data) {
01010                 // fetch pointer to transmit socket buffer
01011                 frame_data =
01012                     ec_device_tx_data(&master->devices[device_index]);
01013                 cur_data = frame_data + EC_FRAME_HEADER_SIZE;
01014             }
01015 
01016             // does the current datagram fit in the frame?
01017             datagram_size = EC_DATAGRAM_HEADER_SIZE + datagram->data_size
01018                 + EC_DATAGRAM_FOOTER_SIZE;
01019             if (cur_data - frame_data + datagram_size > ETH_DATA_LEN) {
01020                 more_datagrams_waiting = 1;
01021                 break;
01022             }
01023 
01024             list_add_tail(&datagram->sent, &sent_datagrams);
01025             datagram->index = master->datagram_index++;
01026 
01027             EC_MASTER_DBG(master, 2, "Adding datagram 0x%02X\n",
01028                     datagram->index);
01029 
01030             // set "datagram following" flag in previous datagram
01031             if (follows_word) {
01032                 EC_WRITE_U16(follows_word,
01033                         EC_READ_U16(follows_word) | 0x8000);
01034             }
01035 
01036             // EtherCAT datagram header
01037             EC_WRITE_U8 (cur_data, datagram->type);
01038             EC_WRITE_U8 (cur_data + 1, datagram->index);
01039             memcpy(cur_data + 2, datagram->address, EC_ADDR_LEN);
01040             EC_WRITE_U16(cur_data + 6, datagram->data_size & 0x7FF);
01041             EC_WRITE_U16(cur_data + 8, 0x0000);
01042             follows_word = cur_data + 6;
01043             cur_data += EC_DATAGRAM_HEADER_SIZE;
01044 
01045             // EtherCAT datagram data
01046             memcpy(cur_data, datagram->data, datagram->data_size);
01047             cur_data += datagram->data_size;
01048 
01049             // EtherCAT datagram footer
01050             EC_WRITE_U16(cur_data, 0x0000); // reset working counter
01051             cur_data += EC_DATAGRAM_FOOTER_SIZE;
01052         }
01053 
01054         if (list_empty(&sent_datagrams)) {
01055             EC_MASTER_DBG(master, 2, "nothing to send.\n");
01056             break;
01057         }
01058 
01059         // EtherCAT frame header
01060         EC_WRITE_U16(frame_data, ((cur_data - frame_data
01061                         - EC_FRAME_HEADER_SIZE) & 0x7FF) | 0x1000);
01062 
01063         // pad frame
01064         while (cur_data - frame_data < ETH_ZLEN - ETH_HLEN)
01065             EC_WRITE_U8(cur_data++, 0x00);
01066 
01067         EC_MASTER_DBG(master, 2, "frame size: %zu\n", cur_data - frame_data);
01068 
01069         // send frame
01070         ec_device_send(&master->devices[device_index],
01071                 cur_data - frame_data);
01072 #ifdef EC_HAVE_CYCLES
01073         cycles_sent = get_cycles();
01074 #endif
01075         jiffies_sent = jiffies;
01076 
01077         // set datagram states and sending timestamps
01078         list_for_each_entry_safe(datagram, next, &sent_datagrams, sent) {
01079             datagram->state = EC_DATAGRAM_SENT;
01080 #ifdef EC_HAVE_CYCLES
01081             datagram->cycles_sent = cycles_sent;
01082 #endif
01083             datagram->jiffies_sent = jiffies_sent;
01084             list_del_init(&datagram->sent); // empty list of sent datagrams
01085         }
01086 
01087         frame_count++;
01088     }
01089     while (more_datagrams_waiting);
01090 
01091 #ifdef EC_HAVE_CYCLES
01092     if (unlikely(master->debug_level > 1)) {
01093         cycles_end = get_cycles();
01094         EC_MASTER_DBG(master, 0, "%s()"
01095                 " sent %u frames in %uus.\n", __func__, frame_count,
01096                (unsigned int) (cycles_end - cycles_start) * 1000 / cpu_khz);
01097     }
01098 #endif
01099 }
01100 
01101 /*****************************************************************************/
01102 
01109 void ec_master_receive_datagrams(ec_master_t *master, 
01110                                  const uint8_t *frame_data, 
01111                                  size_t size 
01112                                  )
01113 {
01114     size_t frame_size, data_size;
01115     uint8_t datagram_type, datagram_index;
01116     unsigned int cmd_follows, matched;
01117     const uint8_t *cur_data;
01118     ec_datagram_t *datagram;
01119 
01120     if (unlikely(size < EC_FRAME_HEADER_SIZE)) {
01121         if (master->debug_level) {
01122             EC_MASTER_DBG(master, 0, "Corrupted frame received"
01123                     " (size %zu < %u byte):\n",
01124                     size, EC_FRAME_HEADER_SIZE);
01125             ec_print_data(frame_data, size);
01126         }
01127         master->stats.corrupted++;
01128         ec_master_output_stats(master);
01129         return;
01130     }
01131 
01132     cur_data = frame_data;
01133 
01134     // check length of entire frame
01135     frame_size = EC_READ_U16(cur_data) & 0x07FF;
01136     cur_data += EC_FRAME_HEADER_SIZE;
01137 
01138     if (unlikely(frame_size > size)) {
01139         if (master->debug_level) {
01140             EC_MASTER_DBG(master, 0, "Corrupted frame received"
01141                     " (invalid frame size %zu for "
01142                     "received size %zu):\n", frame_size, size);
01143             ec_print_data(frame_data, size);
01144         }
01145         master->stats.corrupted++;
01146         ec_master_output_stats(master);
01147         return;
01148     }
01149 
01150     cmd_follows = 1;
01151     while (cmd_follows) {
01152         // process datagram header
01153         datagram_type  = EC_READ_U8 (cur_data);
01154         datagram_index = EC_READ_U8 (cur_data + 1);
01155         data_size      = EC_READ_U16(cur_data + 6) & 0x07FF;
01156         cmd_follows    = EC_READ_U16(cur_data + 6) & 0x8000;
01157         cur_data += EC_DATAGRAM_HEADER_SIZE;
01158 
01159         if (unlikely(cur_data - frame_data
01160                      + data_size + EC_DATAGRAM_FOOTER_SIZE > size)) {
01161             if (master->debug_level) {
01162                 EC_MASTER_DBG(master, 0, "Corrupted frame received"
01163                         " (invalid data size %zu):\n", data_size);
01164                 ec_print_data(frame_data, size);
01165             }
01166             master->stats.corrupted++;
01167             ec_master_output_stats(master);
01168             return;
01169         }
01170 
01171         // search for matching datagram in the queue
01172         matched = 0;
01173         list_for_each_entry(datagram, &master->datagram_queue, queue) {
01174             if (datagram->index == datagram_index
01175                 && datagram->state == EC_DATAGRAM_SENT
01176                 && datagram->type == datagram_type
01177                 && datagram->data_size == data_size) {
01178                 matched = 1;
01179                 break;
01180             }
01181         }
01182 
01183         // no matching datagram was found
01184         if (!matched) {
01185             master->stats.unmatched++;
01186             ec_master_output_stats(master);
01187 
01188             if (unlikely(master->debug_level > 0)) {
01189                 EC_MASTER_DBG(master, 0, "UNMATCHED datagram:\n");
01190                 ec_print_data(cur_data - EC_DATAGRAM_HEADER_SIZE,
01191                         EC_DATAGRAM_HEADER_SIZE + data_size
01192                         + EC_DATAGRAM_FOOTER_SIZE);
01193 #ifdef EC_DEBUG_RING
01194                 ec_device_debug_ring_print(&master->devices[EC_DEVICE_MAIN]);
01195 #endif
01196             }
01197 
01198             cur_data += data_size + EC_DATAGRAM_FOOTER_SIZE;
01199             continue;
01200         }
01201 
01202         if (datagram->type != EC_DATAGRAM_APWR &&
01203                 datagram->type != EC_DATAGRAM_FPWR &&
01204                 datagram->type != EC_DATAGRAM_BWR &&
01205                 datagram->type != EC_DATAGRAM_LWR) {
01206             // copy received data into the datagram memory,
01207             // if something has been read
01208             memcpy(datagram->data, cur_data, data_size);
01209         }
01210         cur_data += data_size;
01211 
01212         // set the datagram's working counter
01213         datagram->working_counter = EC_READ_U16(cur_data);
01214         cur_data += EC_DATAGRAM_FOOTER_SIZE;
01215 
01216         // dequeue the received datagram
01217         datagram->state = EC_DATAGRAM_RECEIVED;
01218 #ifdef EC_HAVE_CYCLES
01219         datagram->cycles_received =
01220             master->devices[EC_DEVICE_MAIN].cycles_poll;
01221 #endif
01222         datagram->jiffies_received =
01223             master->devices[EC_DEVICE_MAIN].jiffies_poll;
01224         list_del_init(&datagram->queue);
01225     }
01226 }
01227 
01228 /*****************************************************************************/
01229 
01235 void ec_master_output_stats(ec_master_t *master )
01236 {
01237     if (unlikely(jiffies - master->stats.output_jiffies >= HZ)) {
01238         master->stats.output_jiffies = jiffies;
01239 
01240         if (master->stats.timeouts) {
01241             EC_MASTER_WARN(master, "%u datagram%s TIMED OUT!\n",
01242                     master->stats.timeouts,
01243                     master->stats.timeouts == 1 ? "" : "s");
01244             master->stats.timeouts = 0;
01245         }
01246         if (master->stats.corrupted) {
01247             EC_MASTER_WARN(master, "%u frame%s CORRUPTED!\n",
01248                     master->stats.corrupted,
01249                     master->stats.corrupted == 1 ? "" : "s");
01250             master->stats.corrupted = 0;
01251         }
01252         if (master->stats.unmatched) {
01253             EC_MASTER_WARN(master, "%u datagram%s UNMATCHED!\n",
01254                     master->stats.unmatched,
01255                     master->stats.unmatched == 1 ? "" : "s");
01256             master->stats.unmatched = 0;
01257         }
01258     }
01259 }
01260 
01261 /*****************************************************************************/
01262 
01265 void ec_master_clear_device_stats(
01266         ec_master_t *master 
01267         )
01268 {
01269     unsigned int i;
01270 
01271     // zero frame statistics
01272     master->device_stats.tx_count = 0;
01273     master->device_stats.last_tx_count = 0;
01274     master->device_stats.rx_count = 0;
01275     master->device_stats.last_rx_count = 0;
01276     master->device_stats.tx_bytes = 0;
01277     master->device_stats.last_tx_bytes = 0;
01278     master->device_stats.rx_bytes = 0;
01279     master->device_stats.last_rx_bytes = 0;
01280     master->device_stats.last_loss = 0;
01281 
01282     for (i = 0; i < EC_RATE_COUNT; i++) {
01283         master->device_stats.tx_frame_rates[i] = 0;
01284         master->device_stats.tx_byte_rates[i] = 0;
01285         master->device_stats.loss_rates[i] = 0;
01286     }
01287 }
01288 
01289 /*****************************************************************************/
01290 
01293 void ec_master_update_device_stats(
01294         ec_master_t *master 
01295         )
01296 {
01297     ec_device_stats_t *s = &master->device_stats;
01298     s32 tx_frame_rate, rx_frame_rate, tx_byte_rate, rx_byte_rate, loss_rate;
01299     u64 loss;
01300     unsigned int i, dev_idx;
01301 
01302     // frame statistics
01303     if (likely(jiffies - s->jiffies < HZ)) {
01304         return;
01305     }
01306 
01307     tx_frame_rate = (s->tx_count - s->last_tx_count) * 1000;
01308     rx_frame_rate = (s->rx_count - s->last_rx_count) * 1000;
01309     tx_byte_rate = s->tx_bytes - s->last_tx_bytes;
01310     rx_byte_rate = s->rx_bytes - s->last_rx_bytes;
01311     loss = s->tx_count - s->rx_count;
01312     loss_rate = (loss - s->last_loss) * 1000;
01313 
01314     /* Low-pass filter:
01315      *      Y_n = y_(n - 1) + T / tau * (x - y_(n - 1))   | T = 1
01316      *   -> Y_n += (x - y_(n - 1)) / tau
01317      */
01318     for (i = 0; i < EC_RATE_COUNT; i++) {
01319         s32 n = rate_intervals[i];
01320         s->tx_frame_rates[i] += (tx_frame_rate - s->tx_frame_rates[i]) / n;
01321         s->rx_frame_rates[i] += (rx_frame_rate - s->rx_frame_rates[i]) / n;
01322         s->tx_byte_rates[i] += (tx_byte_rate - s->tx_byte_rates[i]) / n;
01323         s->rx_byte_rates[i] += (rx_byte_rate - s->rx_byte_rates[i]) / n;
01324         s->loss_rates[i] += (loss_rate - s->loss_rates[i]) / n;
01325     }
01326 
01327     s->last_tx_count = s->tx_count;
01328     s->last_rx_count = s->rx_count;
01329     s->last_tx_bytes = s->tx_bytes;
01330     s->last_rx_bytes = s->rx_bytes;
01331     s->last_loss = loss;
01332 
01333     for (dev_idx = EC_DEVICE_MAIN; dev_idx < ec_master_num_devices(master);
01334             dev_idx++) {
01335         ec_device_update_stats(&master->devices[dev_idx]);
01336     }
01337 
01338     s->jiffies = jiffies;
01339 }
01340 
01341 /*****************************************************************************/
01342 
01343 #ifdef EC_USE_HRTIMER
01344 
01345 /*
01346  * Sleep related functions:
01347  */
01348 static enum hrtimer_restart ec_master_nanosleep_wakeup(struct hrtimer *timer)
01349 {
01350     struct hrtimer_sleeper *t =
01351         container_of(timer, struct hrtimer_sleeper, timer);
01352     struct task_struct *task = t->task;
01353 
01354     t->task = NULL;
01355     if (task)
01356         wake_up_process(task);
01357 
01358     return HRTIMER_NORESTART;
01359 }
01360 
01361 /*****************************************************************************/
01362 
01363 #if LINUX_VERSION_CODE < KERNEL_VERSION(2,6,28)
01364 
01365 /* compatibility with new hrtimer interface */
01366 static inline ktime_t hrtimer_get_expires(const struct hrtimer *timer)
01367 {
01368     return timer->expires;
01369 }
01370 
01371 /*****************************************************************************/
01372 
01373 static inline void hrtimer_set_expires(struct hrtimer *timer, ktime_t time)
01374 {
01375     timer->expires = time;
01376 }
01377 
01378 #endif
01379 
01380 /*****************************************************************************/
01381 
01382 void ec_master_nanosleep(const unsigned long nsecs)
01383 {
01384     struct hrtimer_sleeper t;
01385     enum hrtimer_mode mode = HRTIMER_MODE_REL;
01386 
01387     hrtimer_init(&t.timer, CLOCK_MONOTONIC, mode);
01388     t.timer.function = ec_master_nanosleep_wakeup;
01389     t.task = current;
01390 #ifdef CONFIG_HIGH_RES_TIMERS
01391 #if LINUX_VERSION_CODE <= KERNEL_VERSION(2, 6, 24)
01392     t.timer.cb_mode = HRTIMER_CB_IRQSAFE_NO_RESTART;
01393 #elif LINUX_VERSION_CODE <= KERNEL_VERSION(2, 6, 26)
01394     t.timer.cb_mode = HRTIMER_CB_IRQSAFE_NO_SOFTIRQ;
01395 #elif LINUX_VERSION_CODE <= KERNEL_VERSION(2, 6, 28)
01396     t.timer.cb_mode = HRTIMER_CB_IRQSAFE_UNLOCKED;
01397 #endif
01398 #endif
01399     hrtimer_set_expires(&t.timer, ktime_set(0, nsecs));
01400 
01401     do {
01402         set_current_state(TASK_INTERRUPTIBLE);
01403         hrtimer_start(&t.timer, hrtimer_get_expires(&t.timer), mode);
01404 
01405         if (likely(t.task))
01406             schedule();
01407 
01408         hrtimer_cancel(&t.timer);
01409         mode = HRTIMER_MODE_ABS;
01410 
01411     } while (t.task && !signal_pending(current));
01412 }
01413 
01414 #endif // EC_USE_HRTIMER
01415 
01416 /*****************************************************************************/
01417 
01420 void ec_master_exec_slave_fsms(
01421         ec_master_t *master 
01422         )
01423 {
01424     ec_datagram_t *datagram;
01425     ec_fsm_slave_t *fsm, *next;
01426     unsigned int count = 0;
01427 
01428     list_for_each_entry_safe(fsm, next, &master->fsm_exec_list, list) {
01429         if (!fsm->datagram) {
01430             EC_MASTER_WARN(master, "Slave %u FSM has zero datagram."
01431                     "This is a bug!\n", fsm->slave->ring_position);
01432             list_del_init(&fsm->list);
01433             master->fsm_exec_count--;
01434             return;
01435         }
01436 
01437         if (fsm->datagram->state == EC_DATAGRAM_INIT ||
01438                 fsm->datagram->state == EC_DATAGRAM_QUEUED ||
01439                 fsm->datagram->state == EC_DATAGRAM_SENT) {
01440             // previous datagram was not sent or received yet.
01441             // wait until next thread execution
01442             return;
01443         }
01444 
01445         datagram = ec_master_get_external_datagram(master);
01446         if (!datagram) {
01447             // no free datagrams at the moment
01448             EC_MASTER_WARN(master, "No free datagram during"
01449                     " slave FSM execution. This is a bug!\n");
01450             continue;
01451         }
01452 
01453 #if DEBUG_INJECT
01454         EC_MASTER_DBG(master, 1, "Executing slave %u FSM.\n",
01455                 fsm->slave->ring_position);
01456 #endif
01457         if (ec_fsm_slave_exec(fsm, datagram)) {
01458             // FSM consumed datagram
01459 #if DEBUG_INJECT
01460             EC_MASTER_DBG(master, 1, "FSM consumed datagram %s\n",
01461                     datagram->name);
01462 #endif
01463             master->ext_ring_idx_fsm =
01464                 (master->ext_ring_idx_fsm + 1) % EC_EXT_RING_SIZE;
01465         }
01466         else {
01467             // FSM finished
01468             list_del_init(&fsm->list);
01469             master->fsm_exec_count--;
01470 #if DEBUG_INJECT
01471             EC_MASTER_DBG(master, 1, "FSM finished. %u remaining.\n",
01472                     master->fsm_exec_count);
01473 #endif
01474         }
01475     }
01476 
01477     while (master->fsm_exec_count < EC_EXT_RING_SIZE / 2
01478             && count < master->slave_count) {
01479 
01480         if (ec_fsm_slave_is_ready(&master->fsm_slave->fsm)) {
01481             datagram = ec_master_get_external_datagram(master);
01482 
01483             if (ec_fsm_slave_exec(&master->fsm_slave->fsm, datagram)) {
01484                 master->ext_ring_idx_fsm =
01485                     (master->ext_ring_idx_fsm + 1) % EC_EXT_RING_SIZE;
01486                 list_add_tail(&master->fsm_slave->fsm.list,
01487                         &master->fsm_exec_list);
01488                 master->fsm_exec_count++;
01489 #if DEBUG_INJECT
01490                 EC_MASTER_DBG(master, 1, "New slave %u FSM"
01491                         " consumed datagram %s, now %u FSMs in list.\n",
01492                         master->fsm_slave->ring_position, datagram->name,
01493                         master->fsm_exec_count);
01494 #endif
01495             }
01496         }
01497 
01498         master->fsm_slave++;
01499         if (master->fsm_slave >= master->slaves + master->slave_count) {
01500             master->fsm_slave = master->slaves;
01501         }
01502         count++;
01503     }
01504 }
01505 
01506 /*****************************************************************************/
01507 
01510 static int ec_master_idle_thread(void *priv_data)
01511 {
01512     ec_master_t *master = (ec_master_t *) priv_data;
01513     int fsm_exec;
01514 #ifdef EC_USE_HRTIMER
01515     size_t sent_bytes;
01516 #endif
01517 
01518     // send interval in IDLE phase
01519     ec_master_set_send_interval(master, 1000000 / HZ);
01520 
01521     EC_MASTER_DBG(master, 1, "Idle thread running with send interval = %u us,"
01522             " max data size=%zu\n", master->send_interval,
01523             master->max_queue_size);
01524 
01525     while (!kthread_should_stop()) {
01526         ec_datagram_output_stats(&master->fsm_datagram);
01527 
01528         // receive
01529         down(&master->io_sem);
01530         ecrt_master_receive(master);
01531         up(&master->io_sem);
01532 
01533         // execute master & slave state machines
01534         if (down_interruptible(&master->master_sem)) {
01535             break;
01536         }
01537 
01538         fsm_exec = ec_fsm_master_exec(&master->fsm);
01539 
01540         ec_master_exec_slave_fsms(master);
01541 
01542         up(&master->master_sem);
01543 
01544         // queue and send
01545         down(&master->io_sem);
01546         if (fsm_exec) {
01547             ec_master_queue_datagram(master, &master->fsm_datagram);
01548         }
01549         ecrt_master_send(master);
01550 #ifdef EC_USE_HRTIMER
01551         sent_bytes = master->devices[EC_DEVICE_MAIN].tx_skb[
01552             master->devices[EC_DEVICE_MAIN].tx_ring_index]->len;
01553 #endif
01554         up(&master->io_sem);
01555 
01556         if (ec_fsm_master_idle(&master->fsm)) {
01557 #ifdef EC_USE_HRTIMER
01558             ec_master_nanosleep(master->send_interval * 1000);
01559 #else
01560             set_current_state(TASK_INTERRUPTIBLE);
01561             schedule_timeout(1);
01562 #endif
01563         } else {
01564 #ifdef EC_USE_HRTIMER
01565             ec_master_nanosleep(sent_bytes * EC_BYTE_TRANSMISSION_TIME_NS);
01566 #else
01567             schedule();
01568 #endif
01569         }
01570     }
01571 
01572     EC_MASTER_DBG(master, 1, "Master IDLE thread exiting...\n");
01573 
01574     return 0;
01575 }
01576 
01577 /*****************************************************************************/
01578 
01581 static int ec_master_operation_thread(void *priv_data)
01582 {
01583     ec_master_t *master = (ec_master_t *) priv_data;
01584 
01585     EC_MASTER_DBG(master, 1, "Operation thread running"
01586             " with fsm interval = %u us, max data size=%zu\n",
01587             master->send_interval, master->max_queue_size);
01588 
01589     while (!kthread_should_stop()) {
01590         ec_datagram_output_stats(&master->fsm_datagram);
01591 
01592         if (master->injection_seq_rt == master->injection_seq_fsm) {
01593             // output statistics
01594             ec_master_output_stats(master);
01595 
01596             // execute master & slave state machines
01597             if (down_interruptible(&master->master_sem)) {
01598                 break;
01599             }
01600 
01601             if (ec_fsm_master_exec(&master->fsm)) {
01602                 // Inject datagrams (let the RT thread queue them, see
01603                 // ecrt_master_send())
01604                 master->injection_seq_fsm++;
01605             }
01606 
01607             ec_master_exec_slave_fsms(master);
01608 
01609             up(&master->master_sem);
01610         }
01611 
01612 #ifdef EC_USE_HRTIMER
01613         // the op thread should not work faster than the sending RT thread
01614         ec_master_nanosleep(master->send_interval * 1000);
01615 #else
01616         if (ec_fsm_master_idle(&master->fsm)) {
01617             set_current_state(TASK_INTERRUPTIBLE);
01618             schedule_timeout(1);
01619         }
01620         else {
01621             schedule();
01622         }
01623 #endif
01624     }
01625 
01626     EC_MASTER_DBG(master, 1, "Master OP thread exiting...\n");
01627     return 0;
01628 }
01629 
01630 /*****************************************************************************/
01631 
01632 #ifdef EC_EOE
01633 
01635 void ec_master_eoe_start(ec_master_t *master )
01636 {
01637     struct sched_param param = { .sched_priority = 0 };
01638 
01639     if (master->eoe_thread) {
01640         EC_MASTER_WARN(master, "EoE already running!\n");
01641         return;
01642     }
01643 
01644     if (list_empty(&master->eoe_handlers))
01645         return;
01646 
01647     if (!master->send_cb || !master->receive_cb) {
01648         EC_MASTER_WARN(master, "No EoE processing"
01649                 " because of missing callbacks!\n");
01650         return;
01651     }
01652 
01653     EC_MASTER_INFO(master, "Starting EoE thread.\n");
01654     master->eoe_thread = kthread_run(ec_master_eoe_thread, master,
01655             "EtherCAT-EoE");
01656     if (IS_ERR(master->eoe_thread)) {
01657         int err = (int) PTR_ERR(master->eoe_thread);
01658         EC_MASTER_ERR(master, "Failed to start EoE thread (error %i)!\n",
01659                 err);
01660         master->eoe_thread = NULL;
01661         return;
01662     }
01663 
01664     sched_setscheduler(master->eoe_thread, SCHED_NORMAL, &param);
01665     set_user_nice(master->eoe_thread, 0);
01666 }
01667 
01668 /*****************************************************************************/
01669 
01672 void ec_master_eoe_stop(ec_master_t *master )
01673 {
01674     if (master->eoe_thread) {
01675         EC_MASTER_INFO(master, "Stopping EoE thread.\n");
01676 
01677         kthread_stop(master->eoe_thread);
01678         master->eoe_thread = NULL;
01679         EC_MASTER_INFO(master, "EoE thread exited.\n");
01680     }
01681 }
01682 
01683 /*****************************************************************************/
01684 
01687 static int ec_master_eoe_thread(void *priv_data)
01688 {
01689     ec_master_t *master = (ec_master_t *) priv_data;
01690     ec_eoe_t *eoe;
01691     unsigned int none_open, sth_to_send, all_idle;
01692 
01693     EC_MASTER_DBG(master, 1, "EoE thread running.\n");
01694 
01695     while (!kthread_should_stop()) {
01696         none_open = 1;
01697         all_idle = 1;
01698 
01699         list_for_each_entry(eoe, &master->eoe_handlers, list) {
01700             if (ec_eoe_is_open(eoe)) {
01701                 none_open = 0;
01702                 break;
01703             }
01704         }
01705         if (none_open)
01706             goto schedule;
01707 
01708         // receive datagrams
01709         master->receive_cb(master->cb_data);
01710 
01711         // actual EoE processing
01712         sth_to_send = 0;
01713         list_for_each_entry(eoe, &master->eoe_handlers, list) {
01714             ec_eoe_run(eoe);
01715             if (eoe->queue_datagram) {
01716                 sth_to_send = 1;
01717             }
01718             if (!ec_eoe_is_idle(eoe)) {
01719                 all_idle = 0;
01720             }
01721         }
01722 
01723         if (sth_to_send) {
01724             list_for_each_entry(eoe, &master->eoe_handlers, list) {
01725                 ec_eoe_queue(eoe);
01726             }
01727             // (try to) send datagrams
01728             down(&master->ext_queue_sem);
01729             master->send_cb(master->cb_data);
01730             up(&master->ext_queue_sem);
01731         }
01732 
01733 schedule:
01734         if (all_idle) {
01735             set_current_state(TASK_INTERRUPTIBLE);
01736             schedule_timeout(1);
01737         } else {
01738             schedule();
01739         }
01740     }
01741 
01742     EC_MASTER_DBG(master, 1, "EoE thread exiting...\n");
01743     return 0;
01744 }
01745 #endif
01746 
01747 /*****************************************************************************/
01748 
01751 void ec_master_attach_slave_configs(
01752         ec_master_t *master 
01753         )
01754 {
01755     ec_slave_config_t *sc;
01756 
01757     list_for_each_entry(sc, &master->configs, list) {
01758         ec_slave_config_attach(sc);
01759     }
01760 }
01761 
01762 /*****************************************************************************/
01763 
01767 #define EC_FIND_SLAVE \
01768     do { \
01769         if (alias) { \
01770             for (; slave < master->slaves + master->slave_count; \
01771                     slave++) { \
01772                 if (slave->effective_alias == alias) \
01773                 break; \
01774             } \
01775             if (slave == master->slaves + master->slave_count) \
01776             return NULL; \
01777         } \
01778         \
01779         slave += position; \
01780         if (slave < master->slaves + master->slave_count) { \
01781             return slave; \
01782         } else { \
01783             return NULL; \
01784         } \
01785     } while (0)
01786 
01791 ec_slave_t *ec_master_find_slave(
01792         ec_master_t *master, 
01793         uint16_t alias, 
01794         uint16_t position 
01795         )
01796 {
01797     ec_slave_t *slave = master->slaves;
01798     EC_FIND_SLAVE;
01799 }
01800 
01807 const ec_slave_t *ec_master_find_slave_const(
01808         const ec_master_t *master, 
01809         uint16_t alias, 
01810         uint16_t position 
01811         )
01812 {
01813     const ec_slave_t *slave = master->slaves;
01814     EC_FIND_SLAVE;
01815 }

01832     }

01837 /*****************************************************************************/
01838 
01842 #define EC_FIND_CONFIG \

01845             if (pos--) \
01846                 continue; \
01847             return sc; \
01848         } \
01849         return NULL; \
01850     } while (0)
01851

01857         const ec_master_t *master,

01859         )

01967 
01974 const ec_eoe_t *ec_master_get_eoe_handler_const(
01975         const ec_master_t *master,

01977         )
