01992 /*****************************************************************************/
01993 
01999 int ec_master_debug_level(
02000         ec_master_t *master, 
02001         unsigned int level 
02002         )
02003 {
02004     if (level > 2) {
02005         EC_MASTER_ERR(master, "Invalid debug level %u!\n", level);
02006         return -EINVAL;
02007     }
02008 
02009     if (level != master->debug_level) {
02010         master->debug_level = level;
02011         EC_MASTER_INFO(master, "Master debug level set to %u.\n",
02012                 master->debug_level);
02013     }
02014 
02015     return 0;
02016 }
02017 
02018 /*****************************************************************************/
02019 
02022 void ec_master_find_dc_ref_clock(
02023         ec_master_t *master 
02024         )
02025 {
02026     ec_slave_t *slave, *ref = NULL;
02027 
02028     if (master->dc_ref_config) {
02029         // Use application-selected reference clock
02030         slave = master->dc_ref_config->slave;
02031 
02032         if (slave) {
02033             if (slave->base_dc_supported && slave->has_dc_system_time) {
02034                 ref = slave;
02035             }
02036             else {
02037                 EC_MASTER_WARN(master, "Slave %u can not act as a"
02038                         " DC reference clock!", slave->ring_position);
02039             }
02040         }
02041         else {
02042             EC_MASTER_WARN(master, "DC reference clock config (%u-%u)"
02043                     " has no slave attached!\n", master->dc_ref_config->alias,
02044                     master->dc_ref_config->position);
02045         }
02046     }
02047     else {
02048         // Use first slave with DC support as reference clock
02049         for (slave = master->slaves;
02050                 slave < master->slaves + master->slave_count;
02051                 slave++) {
02052             if (slave->base_dc_supported && slave->has_dc_system_time) {
02053                 ref = slave;
02054                 break;
02055             }
02056         }
02057 
02058     }
02059 
02060     master->dc_ref_clock = ref;
02061 
02062     if (ref) {
02063         EC_MASTER_INFO(master, "Using slave %u as DC reference clock.\n",
02064                 ref->ring_position);
02065     }
02066     else {
02067         EC_MASTER_INFO(master, "No DC reference clock found.\n");
02068     }
02069 
02070     // These calls always succeed, because the
02071     // datagrams have been pre-allocated.
02072     ec_datagram_fpwr(&master->ref_sync_datagram,
02073             ref ? ref->station_address : 0xffff, 0x0910, 4);
02074     ec_datagram_frmw(&master->sync_datagram,
02075             ref ? ref->station_address : 0xffff, 0x0910, 4);
02076 }
02077 
02078 /*****************************************************************************/
02079 
02084 int ec_master_calc_topology_rec(
02085         ec_master_t *master, 
02086         ec_slave_t *port0_slave, 
02087         unsigned int *slave_position 
02088         )
02089 {
02090     ec_slave_t *slave = master->slaves + *slave_position;
02091     unsigned int port_index;
02092     int ret;
02093 
02094     static const unsigned int next_table[EC_MAX_PORTS] = {
02095         3, 2, 0, 1
02096     };
02097 
02098     slave->ports[0].next_slave = port0_slave;
02099 
02100     port_index = 3;
02101     while (port_index != 0) {
02102         if (!slave->ports[port_index].link.loop_closed) {
02103             *slave_position = *slave_position + 1;
02104             if (*slave_position < master->slave_count) {
02105                 slave->ports[port_index].next_slave =
02106                     master->slaves + *slave_position;
02107                 ret = ec_master_calc_topology_rec(master,
02108                         slave, slave_position);
02109                 if (ret) {
02110                     return ret;
02111                 }
02112             } else {
02113                 return -1;
02114             }
02115         }
02116 
02117         port_index = next_table[port_index];
02118     }
02119 
02120     return 0;
02121 }
02122 
02123 /*****************************************************************************/
02124 
02127 void ec_master_calc_topology(
02128         ec_master_t *master 
02129         )
02130 {
02131     unsigned int slave_position = 0;
02132 
02133     if (master->slave_count == 0)
02134         return;
02135 
02136     if (ec_master_calc_topology_rec(master, NULL, &slave_position))
02137         EC_MASTER_ERR(master, "Failed to calculate bus topology.\n");
02138 }
02139 
02140 /*****************************************************************************/
02141 
02144 void ec_master_calc_transmission_delays(
02145         ec_master_t *master 
02146         )
02147 {
02148     ec_slave_t *slave;
02149 
02150     for (slave = master->slaves;
02151             slave < master->slaves + master->slave_count;
02152             slave++) {
02153         ec_slave_calc_port_delays(slave);
02154     }
02155 
02156     if (master->dc_ref_clock) {
02157         uint32_t delay = 0;
02158         ec_slave_calc_transmission_delays_rec(master->dc_ref_clock, &delay);
02159     }
02160 }
02161 
02162 /*****************************************************************************/
02163 
02166 void ec_master_calc_dc(
02167         ec_master_t *master 
02168         )
02169 {
02170     // find DC reference clock
02171     ec_master_find_dc_ref_clock(master);
02172 
02173     // calculate bus topology
02174     ec_master_calc_topology(master);
02175 
02176     ec_master_calc_transmission_delays(master);
02177 }
02178 
02179 /*****************************************************************************/
02180 
02183 void ec_master_request_op(
02184         ec_master_t *master 
02185         )
02186 {
02187     unsigned int i;
02188     ec_slave_t *slave;
02189 
02190     if (!master->active)
02191         return;
02192 
02193     EC_MASTER_DBG(master, 1, "Requesting OP...\n");
02194 
02195     // request OP for all configured slaves
02196     for (i = 0; i < master->slave_count; i++) {
02197         slave = master->slaves + i;
02198         if (slave->config) {
02199             ec_slave_request_state(slave, EC_SLAVE_STATE_OP);
02200         }
02201     }
02202 
02203     // always set DC reference clock to OP
02204     if (master->dc_ref_clock) {
02205         ec_slave_request_state(master->dc_ref_clock, EC_SLAVE_STATE_OP);
02206     }
02207 }
02208 
02209 /******************************************************************************
02210  *  Application interface
02211  *****************************************************************************/
02212 
02217 ec_domain_t *ecrt_master_create_domain_err(
02218         ec_master_t *master 
02219         )
02220 {
02221     ec_domain_t *domain, *last_domain;
02222     unsigned int index;
02223 
02224     EC_MASTER_DBG(master, 1, "ecrt_master_create_domain(master = 0x%p)\n",
02225             master);
02226 
02227     if (!(domain =
02228                 (ec_domain_t *) kmalloc(sizeof(ec_domain_t), GFP_KERNEL))) {
02229         EC_MASTER_ERR(master, "Error allocating domain memory!\n");
02230         return ERR_PTR(-ENOMEM);
02231     }
02232 
02233     down(&master->master_sem);
02234 
02235     if (list_empty(&master->domains)) {
02236         index = 0;
02237     } else {
02238         last_domain = list_entry(master->domains.prev, ec_domain_t, list);
02239         index = last_domain->index + 1;
02240     }
02241 
02242     ec_domain_init(domain, master, index);
02243     list_add_tail(&domain->list, &master->domains);
02244 
02245     up(&master->master_sem);
02246 
02247     EC_MASTER_DBG(master, 1, "Created domain %u.\n", domain->index);
02248 
02249     return domain;
02250 }
02251 
02252 /*****************************************************************************/
02253 
02254 ec_domain_t *ecrt_master_create_domain(
02255         ec_master_t *master 
02256         )
02257 {
02258     ec_domain_t *d = ecrt_master_create_domain_err(master);
02259     return IS_ERR(d) ? NULL : d;
02260 }
02261 
02262 /*****************************************************************************/
02263 
02264 int ecrt_master_activate(ec_master_t *master)
02265 {
02266     uint32_t domain_offset;
02267     ec_domain_t *domain;
02268     int ret;
02269 #ifdef EC_EOE
02270     int eoe_was_running;
02271 #endif
02272 
02273     EC_MASTER_DBG(master, 1, "ecrt_master_activate(master = 0x%p)\n", master);
02274 
02275     if (master->active) {
02276         EC_MASTER_WARN(master, "%s: Master already active!\n", __func__);
02277         return 0;
02278     }
02279 
02280     down(&master->master_sem);
02281 
02282     // finish all domains
02283     domain_offset = 0;
02284     list_for_each_entry(domain, &master->domains, list) {
02285         ret = ec_domain_finish(domain, domain_offset);
02286         if (ret < 0) {
02287             up(&master->master_sem);
02288             EC_MASTER_ERR(master, "Failed to finish domain 0x%p!\n", domain);
02289             return ret;
02290         }
02291         domain_offset += domain->data_size;
02292     }
02293 
02294     up(&master->master_sem);
02295 
02296     // restart EoE process and master thread with new locking
02297 
02298     ec_master_thread_stop(master);
02299 #ifdef EC_EOE
02300     eoe_was_running = master->eoe_thread != NULL;
02301     ec_master_eoe_stop(master);
02302 #endif
02303 
02304     EC_MASTER_DBG(master, 1, "FSM datagram is %p.\n", &master->fsm_datagram);
02305 
02306     master->injection_seq_fsm = 0;
02307     master->injection_seq_rt = 0;
02308 
02309     master->send_cb = master->app_send_cb;
02310     master->receive_cb = master->app_receive_cb;
02311     master->cb_data = master->app_cb_data;
02312 
02313 #ifdef EC_EOE
02314     if (eoe_was_running) {
02315         ec_master_eoe_start(master);
02316     }
02317 #endif
02318     ret = ec_master_thread_start(master, ec_master_operation_thread,
02319                 "EtherCAT-OP");
02320     if (ret < 0) {
02321         EC_MASTER_ERR(master, "Failed to start master thread!\n");
02322         return ret;
02323     }
02324 
02325     /* Allow scanning after a topology change. */
02326     master->allow_scan = 1;
02327 
02328     master->active = 1;
02329 
02330     // notify state machine, that the configuration shall now be applied
02331     master->config_changed = 1;
02332 
02333     return 0;
02334 }
02335 
02336 /*****************************************************************************/
02337 
02338 void ecrt_master_deactivate(ec_master_t *master)
02339 {
02340     ec_slave_t *slave;
02341 #ifdef EC_EOE
02342     ec_eoe_t *eoe;
02343     int eoe_was_running;
02344 #endif
02345 
02346     EC_MASTER_DBG(master, 1, "%s(master = 0x%p)\n", __func__, master);
02347 
02348     if (!master->active) {
02349         EC_MASTER_WARN(master, "%s: Master not active.\n", __func__);
02350         return;
02351     }
02352 
02353     ec_master_thread_stop(master);
02354 #ifdef EC_EOE
02355     eoe_was_running = master->eoe_thread != NULL;
02356     ec_master_eoe_stop(master);
02357 #endif
02358 
02359     master->send_cb = ec_master_internal_send_cb;
02360     master->receive_cb = ec_master_internal_receive_cb;
02361     master->cb_data = master;
02362 
02363     ec_master_clear_config(master);
02364 
02365     for (slave = master->slaves;
02366             slave < master->slaves + master->slave_count;
02367             slave++) {
02368 
02369         // set states for all slaves
02370         ec_slave_request_state(slave, EC_SLAVE_STATE_PREOP);
02371 
02372         // mark for reconfiguration, because the master could have no
02373         // possibility for a reconfiguration between two sequential operation
02374         // phases.
02375         slave->force_config = 1;
02376     }
02377 
02378 #ifdef EC_EOE
02379     // ... but leave EoE slaves in OP
02380     list_for_each_entry(eoe, &master->eoe_handlers, list) {
02381         if (ec_eoe_is_open(eoe))
02382             ec_slave_request_state(eoe->slave, EC_SLAVE_STATE_OP);
02383     }
02384 #endif
02385 
02386     master->app_time = 0ULL;
02387     master->app_start_time = 0ULL;
02388     master->has_app_time = 0;
02389 
02390 #ifdef EC_EOE
02391     if (eoe_was_running) {
02392         ec_master_eoe_start(master);
02393     }
02394 #endif
02395     if (ec_master_thread_start(master, ec_master_idle_thread,
02396                 "EtherCAT-IDLE")) {
02397         EC_MASTER_WARN(master, "Failed to restart master thread!\n");
02398     }
02399 
02400     /* Disallow scanning to get into the same state like after a master
02401      * request (after ec_master_enter_operation_phase() is called). */
02402     master->allow_scan = 0;
02403 
02404     master->active = 0;
02405 }
02406 
02407 /*****************************************************************************/
02408 
02409 void ecrt_master_send(ec_master_t *master)
02410 {
02411     ec_datagram_t *datagram, *n;
02412     ec_device_index_t dev_idx;
02413 
02414     if (master->injection_seq_rt != master->injection_seq_fsm) {
02415         // inject datagram produced by master FSM
02416         ec_master_queue_datagram(master, &master->fsm_datagram);
02417         master->injection_seq_rt = master->injection_seq_fsm;
02418     }
02419 
02420     ec_master_inject_external_datagrams(master);
02421 
02422     for (dev_idx = EC_DEVICE_MAIN; dev_idx < ec_master_num_devices(master);
02423             dev_idx++) {
02424         if (unlikely(!master->devices[dev_idx].link_state)) {
02425             // link is down, no datagram can be sent
02426             list_for_each_entry_safe(datagram, n,
02427                     &master->datagram_queue, queue) {
02428                 if (datagram->device_index == dev_idx) {
02429                     datagram->state = EC_DATAGRAM_ERROR;
02430                     list_del_init(&datagram->queue);
02431                 }
02432             }
02433 
02434             if (!master->devices[dev_idx].dev) {
02435                 continue;
02436             }
02437 
02438             // query link state
02439             ec_device_poll(&master->devices[dev_idx]);
02440 
02441             // clear frame statistics
02442             ec_device_clear_stats(&master->devices[dev_idx]);
02443             continue;
02444         }
02445 
02446         // send frames
02447         ec_master_send_datagrams(master, dev_idx);
02448     }
02449 }
02450 
02451 /*****************************************************************************/
02452 
02453 void ecrt_master_receive(ec_master_t *master)
02454 {
02455     unsigned int dev_idx;
02456     ec_datagram_t *datagram, *next;
02457 
02458     // receive datagrams
02459     for (dev_idx = EC_DEVICE_MAIN; dev_idx < ec_master_num_devices(master);
02460             dev_idx++) {
02461         ec_device_poll(&master->devices[dev_idx]);
02462     }
02463     ec_master_update_device_stats(master);
02464 
02465     // dequeue all datagrams that timed out
02466     list_for_each_entry_safe(datagram, next, &master->datagram_queue, queue) {
02467         if (datagram->state != EC_DATAGRAM_SENT) continue;
02468 
02469 #ifdef EC_HAVE_CYCLES
02470         if (master->devices[EC_DEVICE_MAIN].cycles_poll -
02471                 datagram->cycles_sent > timeout_cycles) {
02472 #else
02473         if (master->devices[EC_DEVICE_MAIN].jiffies_poll -
02474                 datagram->jiffies_sent > timeout_jiffies) {
02475 #endif
02476             list_del_init(&datagram->queue);
02477             datagram->state = EC_DATAGRAM_TIMED_OUT;
02478             master->stats.timeouts++;
02479             ec_master_output_stats(master);
02480 
02481             if (unlikely(master->debug_level > 0)) {
02482                 unsigned int time_us;
02483 #ifdef EC_HAVE_CYCLES
02484                 time_us = (unsigned int)
02485                     (master->devices[EC_DEVICE_MAIN].cycles_poll -
02486                         datagram->cycles_sent) * 1000 / cpu_khz;
02487 #else
02488                 time_us = (unsigned int)
02489                     ((master->devices[EC_DEVICE_MAIN].jiffies_poll -
02490                             datagram->jiffies_sent) * 1000000 / HZ);
02491 #endif
02492                 EC_MASTER_DBG(master, 0, "TIMED OUT datagram %p,"
02493                         " index %02X waited %u us.\n",
02494                         datagram, datagram->index, time_us);
02495             }
02496         }
02497     }
02498 }
02499 
02500 /*****************************************************************************/
02501 
02502 void ecrt_master_send_ext(ec_master_t *master)
02503 {
02504     ec_datagram_t *datagram, *next;
02505 
02506     list_for_each_entry_safe(datagram, next, &master->ext_datagram_queue,
02507             queue) {
02508         list_del(&datagram->queue);
02509         ec_master_queue_datagram(master, datagram);
02510     }
02511 
02512     ecrt_master_send(master);
02513 }
02514 
02515 /*****************************************************************************/
02516 
02519 ec_slave_config_t *ecrt_master_slave_config_err(ec_master_t *master,
02520         uint16_t alias, uint16_t position, uint32_t vendor_id,
02521         uint32_t product_code)
02522 {
02523     ec_slave_config_t *sc;
02524     unsigned int found = 0;
02525 
02526 
02527     EC_MASTER_DBG(master, 1, "ecrt_master_slave_config(master = 0x%p,"
02528             " alias = %u, position = %u, vendor_id = 0x%08x,"
02529             " product_code = 0x%08x)\n",
02530             master, alias, position, vendor_id, product_code);
02531 
02532     list_for_each_entry(sc, &master->configs, list) {
02533         if (sc->alias == alias && sc->position == position) {
02534             found = 1;
02535             break;
02536         }
02537     }
02538 
02539     if (found) { // config with same alias/position already existing
02540         if (sc->vendor_id != vendor_id || sc->product_code != product_code) {
02541             EC_MASTER_ERR(master, "Slave type mismatch. Slave was"
02542                     " configured as 0x%08X/0x%08X before. Now configuring"
02543                     " with 0x%08X/0x%08X.\n", sc->vendor_id, sc->product_code,
02544                     vendor_id, product_code);
02545             return ERR_PTR(-ENOENT);
02546         }
02547     } else {
02548         EC_MASTER_DBG(master, 1, "Creating slave configuration for %u:%u,"
02549                 " 0x%08X/0x%08X.\n",
02550                 alias, position, vendor_id, product_code);
02551 
02552         if (!(sc = (ec_slave_config_t *) kmalloc(sizeof(ec_slave_config_t),
02553                         GFP_KERNEL))) {
02554             EC_MASTER_ERR(master, "Failed to allocate memory"
02555                     " for slave configuration.\n");
02556             return ERR_PTR(-ENOMEM);
02557         }
02558 
02559         ec_slave_config_init(sc, master,
02560                 alias, position, vendor_id, product_code);
02561 
02562         down(&master->master_sem);
02563 
02564         // try to find the addressed slave
02565         ec_slave_config_attach(sc);
02566         ec_slave_config_load_default_sync_config(sc);
02567         list_add_tail(&sc->list, &master->configs);
02568 
02569         up(&master->master_sem);
02570     }
02571 
02572     return sc;
02573 }
02574 
02575 /*****************************************************************************/
02576 
02577 ec_slave_config_t *ecrt_master_slave_config(ec_master_t *master,
02578         uint16_t alias, uint16_t position, uint32_t vendor_id,
02579         uint32_t product_code)
02580 {
02581     ec_slave_config_t *sc = ecrt_master_slave_config_err(master, alias,
02582             position, vendor_id, product_code);
02583     return IS_ERR(sc) ? NULL : sc;
02584 }
02585 
02586 /*****************************************************************************/
02587 
02588 int ecrt_master_select_reference_clock(ec_master_t *master,
02589         ec_slave_config_t *sc)
02590 {
02591     if (sc) {
02592         ec_slave_t *slave = sc->slave;
02593 
02594         // output an early warning
02595         if (slave &&
02596                 (!slave->base_dc_supported || !slave->has_dc_system_time)) {
02597             EC_MASTER_WARN(master, "Slave %u can not act as"
02598                     " a reference clock!", slave->ring_position);
02599         }
02600     }
02601 
02602     master->dc_ref_config = sc;
02603     return 0;
02604 }
02605 
02606 /*****************************************************************************/
02607 
02608 int ecrt_master(ec_master_t *master, ec_master_info_t *master_info)
02609 {
02610     EC_MASTER_DBG(master, 1, "ecrt_master(master = 0x%p,"
02611             " master_info = 0x%p)\n", master, master_info);
02612 
02613     master_info->slave_count = master->slave_count;
02614     master_info->link_up = master->devices[EC_DEVICE_MAIN].link_state;
02615     master_info->scan_busy = master->scan_busy;
02616     master_info->app_time = master->app_time;
02617     return 0;
02618 }
02619 
02620 /*****************************************************************************/
02621 
02622 int ecrt_master_get_slave(ec_master_t *master, uint16_t slave_position,
02623         ec_slave_info_t *slave_info)
02624 {
02625     const ec_slave_t *slave;
02626     unsigned int i;
02627 
02628     if (down_interruptible(&master->master_sem)) {
02629         return -EINTR;
02630     }
02631 
02632     slave = ec_master_find_slave_const(master, 0, slave_position);
02633 
02634     slave_info->position = slave->ring_position;
02635     slave_info->vendor_id = slave->sii.vendor_id;
02636     slave_info->product_code = slave->sii.product_code;
02637     slave_info->revision_number = slave->sii.revision_number;
02638     slave_info->serial_number = slave->sii.serial_number;
02639     slave_info->alias = slave->effective_alias;
02640     slave_info->current_on_ebus = slave->sii.current_on_ebus;
02641 
02642     for (i = 0; i < EC_MAX_PORTS; i++) {
02643         slave_info->ports[i].desc = slave->ports[i].desc;
02644         slave_info->ports[i].link.link_up = slave->ports[i].link.link_up;
02645         slave_info->ports[i].link.loop_closed =
02646             slave->ports[i].link.loop_closed;
02647         slave_info->ports[i].link.signal_detected =
02648             slave->ports[i].link.signal_detected;
02649         slave_info->ports[i].receive_time = slave->ports[i].receive_time;
02650         if (slave->ports[i].next_slave) {
02651             slave_info->ports[i].next_slave =
02652                 slave->ports[i].next_slave->ring_position;
02653         } else {
02654             slave_info->ports[i].next_slave = 0xffff;
02655         }
02656         slave_info->ports[i].delay_to_next_dc =
02657             slave->ports[i].delay_to_next_dc;
02658     }
02659 
02660     slave_info->al_state = slave->current_state;
02661     slave_info->error_flag = slave->error_flag;
02662     slave_info->sync_count = slave->sii.sync_count;
02663     slave_info->sdo_count = ec_slave_sdo_count(slave);
02664     if (slave->sii.name) {
02665         strncpy(slave_info->name, slave->sii.name, EC_MAX_STRING_LENGTH);
02666     } else {
02667         slave_info->name[0] = 0;
02668     }
02669 
02670     up(&master->master_sem);
02671 
02672     return 0;
02673 }
02674 
02675 /*****************************************************************************/
02676 
02677 void ecrt_master_callbacks(ec_master_t *master,
02678         void (*send_cb)(void *), void (*receive_cb)(void *), void *cb_data)
02679 {
02680     EC_MASTER_DBG(master, 1, "ecrt_master_callbacks(master = 0x%p,"
02681             " send_cb = 0x%p, receive_cb = 0x%p, cb_data = 0x%p)\n",
02682             master, send_cb, receive_cb, cb_data);
02683 
02684     master->app_send_cb = send_cb;
02685     master->app_receive_cb = receive_cb;
02686     master->app_cb_data = cb_data;
02687 }
02688 
02689 /*****************************************************************************/
02690 
02691 void ecrt_master_state(const ec_master_t *master, ec_master_state_t *state)
02692 {
02693     ec_device_index_t dev_idx;
02694 
02695     state->slaves_responding = 0U;
02696     state->al_states = 0;
02697     state->link_up = 0U;
02698 
02699     for (dev_idx = EC_DEVICE_MAIN; dev_idx < ec_master_num_devices(master);
02700             dev_idx++) {
02701         /* Announce sum of responding slaves on all links. */
02702         state->slaves_responding += master->fsm.slaves_responding[dev_idx];
02703 
02704         /* Binary-or slave states of all links. */
02705         state->al_states |= master->fsm.slave_states[dev_idx];
02706 
02707         /* Signal link up if at least one device has link. */
02708         state->link_up |= master->devices[dev_idx].link_state;
02709     }
02710 }
02711 
02712 /*****************************************************************************/
02713 
02714 int ecrt_master_link_state(const ec_master_t *master, unsigned int dev_idx,
02715         ec_master_link_state_t *state)
02716 {
02717     if (dev_idx >= ec_master_num_devices(master)) {
02718         return -EINVAL;
02719     }
02720 
02721     state->slaves_responding = master->fsm.slaves_responding[dev_idx];
02722     state->al_states = master->fsm.slave_states[dev_idx];
02723     state->link_up = master->devices[dev_idx].link_state;
02724 
02725     return 0;
02726 }
02727 
02728 /*****************************************************************************/
02729 
02730 void ecrt_master_application_time(ec_master_t *master, uint64_t app_time)
02731 {
02732     master->app_time = app_time;
02733 
02734     if (unlikely(!master->has_app_time)) {
02735         master->app_start_time = app_time;
02736         master->has_app_time = 1;
02737     }
02738 }
02739 
02740 /*****************************************************************************/
02741 
02742 int ecrt_master_reference_clock_time(ec_master_t *master, uint32_t *time)
02743 {
02744     if (!master->dc_ref_clock) {
02745         return -ENXIO;
02746     }
02747 
02748     if (master->sync_datagram.state != EC_DATAGRAM_RECEIVED) {
02749         return -EIO;
02750     }
02751 
02752     // Get returned datagram time, transmission delay removed.
02753     *time = EC_READ_U32(master->sync_datagram.data) -
02754         master->dc_ref_clock->transmission_delay;
02755 
02756     return 0;
02757 }
02758 
02759 /*****************************************************************************/
02760 
02761 void ecrt_master_sync_reference_clock(ec_master_t *master)
02762 {
02763     if (master->dc_ref_clock) {
02764         EC_WRITE_U32(master->ref_sync_datagram.data, master->app_time);
02765         ec_master_queue_datagram(master, &master->ref_sync_datagram);
02766     }
02767 }
02768 
02769 /*****************************************************************************/
02770 
02771 void ecrt_master_sync_slave_clocks(ec_master_t *master)
02772 {
02773     if (master->dc_ref_clock) {
02774         ec_datagram_zero(&master->sync_datagram);
02775         ec_master_queue_datagram(master, &master->sync_datagram);
02776     }
02777 }
02778 
02779 /*****************************************************************************/
02780 
02781 void ecrt_master_sync_monitor_queue(ec_master_t *master)
02782 {
02783     ec_datagram_zero(&master->sync_mon_datagram);
02784     ec_master_queue_datagram(master, &master->sync_mon_datagram);
02785 }
02786 
02787 /*****************************************************************************/
02788 
02789 uint32_t ecrt_master_sync_monitor_process(ec_master_t *master)
02790 {
02791     if (master->sync_mon_datagram.state == EC_DATAGRAM_RECEIVED) {
02792         return EC_READ_U32(master->sync_mon_datagram.data) & 0x7fffffff;
02793     } else {
02794         return 0xffffffff;
02795     }
02796 }
02797 
02798 /*****************************************************************************/
02799 
02800 int ecrt_master_sdo_download(ec_master_t *master, uint16_t slave_position,
02801         uint16_t index, uint8_t subindex, uint8_t *data,
02802         size_t data_size, uint32_t *abort_code)
02803 {
02804     ec_sdo_request_t request;
02805     ec_slave_t *slave;
02806     int ret;
02807 
02808     EC_MASTER_DBG(master, 1, "%s(master = 0x%p,"
02809             " slave_position = %u, index = 0x%04X, subindex = 0x%02X,"
02810             " data = 0x%p, data_size = %zu, abort_code = 0x%p)\n",
02811             __func__, master, slave_position, index, subindex,
02812             data, data_size, abort_code);
02813 
02814     if (!data_size) {
02815         EC_MASTER_ERR(master, "Zero data size!\n");
02816         return -EINVAL;
02817     }
02818 
02819     ec_sdo_request_init(&request);
02820     ecrt_sdo_request_index(&request, index, subindex);
02821     ret = ec_sdo_request_alloc(&request, data_size);
02822     if (ret) {
02823         ec_sdo_request_clear(&request);
02824         return ret;
02825     }
02826 
02827     memcpy(request.data, data, data_size);
02828     request.data_size = data_size;
02829     ecrt_sdo_request_write(&request);
02830 
02831     if (down_interruptible(&master->master_sem)) {
02832         ec_sdo_request_clear(&request);
02833         return -EINTR;
02834     }
02835 
02836     if (!(slave = ec_master_find_slave(master, 0, slave_position))) {
02837         up(&master->master_sem);
02838         EC_MASTER_ERR(master, "Slave %u does not exist!\n", slave_position);
02839         ec_sdo_request_clear(&request);
02840         return -EINVAL;
02841     }
02842 
02843     EC_SLAVE_DBG(slave, 1, "Scheduling SDO download request.\n");
02844 
02845     // schedule request.
02846     list_add_tail(&request.list, &slave->sdo_requests);
02847 
02848     up(&master->master_sem);
02849 
02850     // wait for processing through FSM
02851     if (wait_event_interruptible(master->request_queue,
02852                 request.state != EC_INT_REQUEST_QUEUED)) {
02853         // interrupted by signal
02854         down(&master->master_sem);
02855         if (request.state == EC_INT_REQUEST_QUEUED) {
02856             list_del(&request.list);
02857             up(&master->master_sem);
02858             ec_sdo_request_clear(&request);
02859             return -EINTR;
02860         }
02861         // request already processing: interrupt not possible.
02862         up(&master->master_sem);
02863     }
02864 
02865     // wait until master FSM has finished processing
02866     wait_event(master->request_queue, request.state != EC_INT_REQUEST_BUSY);
02867 
02868     *abort_code = request.abort_code;
02869 
02870     if (request.state == EC_INT_REQUEST_SUCCESS) {
02871         ret = 0;
02872     } else if (request.errno) {
02873         ret = -request.errno;
02874     } else {
02875         ret = -EIO;
02876     }
02877 
02878     ec_sdo_request_clear(&request);
02879     return ret;
02880 }
02881 
02882 /*****************************************************************************/
02883 
02884 int ecrt_master_sdo_download_complete(ec_master_t *master,
02885         uint16_t slave_position, uint16_t index, uint8_t *data,
02886         size_t data_size, uint32_t *abort_code)
02887 {
02888     ec_sdo_request_t request;
02889     ec_slave_t *slave;
02890     int ret;
02891 
02892     EC_MASTER_DBG(master, 1, "%s(master = 0x%p,"
02893             " slave_position = %u, index = 0x%04X,"
02894             " data = 0x%p, data_size = %zu, abort_code = 0x%p)\n",
02895             __func__, master, slave_position, index, data, data_size,
02896             abort_code);
02897 
02898     if (!data_size) {
02899         EC_MASTER_ERR(master, "Zero data size!\n");
02900         return -EINVAL;
02901     }
02902 
02903     ec_sdo_request_init(&request);
02904     ecrt_sdo_request_index(&request, index, 0);
02905     ret = ec_sdo_request_alloc(&request, data_size);
02906     if (ret) {
02907         ec_sdo_request_clear(&request);
02908         return ret;
02909     }
02910 
02911     request.complete_access = 1;
02912     memcpy(request.data, data, data_size);
02913     request.data_size = data_size;
02914     ecrt_sdo_request_write(&request);
02915 
02916     if (down_interruptible(&master->master_sem)) {
02917         ec_sdo_request_clear(&request);
02918         return -EINTR;
02919     }
02920 
02921     if (!(slave = ec_master_find_slave(master, 0, slave_position))) {
02922         up(&master->master_sem);
02923         EC_MASTER_ERR(master, "Slave %u does not exist!\n", slave_position);
02924         ec_sdo_request_clear(&request);
02925         return -EINVAL;
02926     }
02927 
02928     EC_SLAVE_DBG(slave, 1, "Scheduling SDO download request"
02929             " (complete access).\n");
02930 
02931     // schedule request.
02932     list_add_tail(&request.list, &slave->sdo_requests);
02933 
02934     up(&master->master_sem);
02935 
02936     // wait for processing through FSM
02937     if (wait_event_interruptible(master->request_queue,
02938                 request.state != EC_INT_REQUEST_QUEUED)) {
02939         // interrupted by signal
02940         down(&master->master_sem);
02941         if (request.state == EC_INT_REQUEST_QUEUED) {
02942             list_del(&request.list);
02943             up(&master->master_sem);
02944             ec_sdo_request_clear(&request);
02945             return -EINTR;
02946         }
02947         // request already processing: interrupt not possible.
02948         up(&master->master_sem);
02949     }
02950 
02951     // wait until master FSM has finished processing
02952     wait_event(master->request_queue, request.state != EC_INT_REQUEST_BUSY);
02953 
02954     *abort_code = request.abort_code;
02955 
02956     if (request.state == EC_INT_REQUEST_SUCCESS) {
02957         ret = 0;
02958     } else if (request.errno) {
02959         ret = -request.errno;
02960     } else {
02961         ret = -EIO;
02962     }
02963 
02964     ec_sdo_request_clear(&request);
02965     return ret;
02966 }
02967 
02968 /*****************************************************************************/
02969 
02970 int ecrt_master_sdo_upload(ec_master_t *master, uint16_t slave_position,
02971         uint16_t index, uint8_t subindex, uint8_t *target,
02972         size_t target_size, size_t *result_size, uint32_t *abort_code)
02973 {
02974     ec_sdo_request_t request;
02975     ec_slave_t *slave;
02976     int ret = 0;
02977 
02978     EC_MASTER_DBG(master, 1, "%s(master = 0x%p,"
02979             " slave_position = %u, index = 0x%04X, subindex = 0x%02X,"
02980             " target = 0x%p, target_size = %zu, result_size = 0x%p,"
02981             " abort_code = 0x%p)\n",
02982             __func__, master, slave_position, index, subindex,
02983             target, target_size, result_size, abort_code);
02984 
02985     ec_sdo_request_init(&request);
02986     ecrt_sdo_request_index(&request, index, subindex);
02987     ecrt_sdo_request_read(&request);
02988 
02989     if (down_interruptible(&master->master_sem)) {
02990         ec_sdo_request_clear(&request);
02991         return -EINTR;
02992     }
02993 
02994     if (!(slave = ec_master_find_slave(master, 0, slave_position))) {
02995         up(&master->master_sem);
02996         ec_sdo_request_clear(&request);
02997         EC_MASTER_ERR(master, "Slave %u does not exist!\n", slave_position);
02998         return -EINVAL;
02999     }
03000 
03001     EC_SLAVE_DBG(slave, 1, "Scheduling SDO upload request.\n");
03002 
03003     // schedule request.
03004     list_add_tail(&request.list, &slave->sdo_requests);
03005 
03006     up(&master->master_sem);
03007 
03008     // wait for processing through FSM
03009     if (wait_event_interruptible(master->request_queue,
03010                 request.state != EC_INT_REQUEST_QUEUED)) {
03011         // interrupted by signal
03012         down(&master->master_sem);
03013         if (request.state == EC_INT_REQUEST_QUEUED) {
03014             list_del(&request.list);
03015             up(&master->master_sem);
03016             ec_sdo_request_clear(&request);
03017             return -EINTR;
03018         }
03019         // request already processing: interrupt not possible.
03020         up(&master->master_sem);
03021     }
03022 
03023     // wait until master FSM has finished processing
03024     wait_event(master->request_queue, request.state != EC_INT_REQUEST_BUSY);
03025 
03026     *abort_code = request.abort_code;
03027 
03028     if (request.state != EC_INT_REQUEST_SUCCESS) {
03029         *result_size = 0;
03030         if (request.errno) {
03031             ret = -request.errno;
03032         } else {
03033             ret = -EIO;
03034         }
03035     } else {
03036         if (request.data_size > target_size) {
03037             EC_MASTER_ERR(master, "Buffer too small.\n");
03038             ret = -EOVERFLOW;
03039         }
03040         else {
03041             memcpy(target, request.data, request.data_size);
03042             *result_size = request.data_size;
03043             ret = 0;
03044         }
03045     }
03046 
03047     ec_sdo_request_clear(&request);
03048     return ret;
03049 }
03050 
03051 /*****************************************************************************/
03052 
03053 int ecrt_master_write_idn(ec_master_t *master, uint16_t slave_position,
03054         uint8_t drive_no, uint16_t idn, uint8_t *data, size_t data_size,
03055         uint16_t *error_code)
03056 {
03057     ec_soe_request_t request;
03058     ec_slave_t *slave;
03059     int ret;
03060 
03061     if (drive_no > 7) {
03062         EC_MASTER_ERR(master, "Invalid drive number!\n");
03063         return -EINVAL;
03064     }
03065 
03066     ec_soe_request_init(&request);
03067     ec_soe_request_set_drive_no(&request, drive_no);
03068     ec_soe_request_set_idn(&request, idn);
03069 
03070     ret = ec_soe_request_alloc(&request, data_size);
03071     if (ret) {
03072         ec_soe_request_clear(&request);
03073         return ret;
03074     }
03075 
03076     memcpy(request.data, data, data_size);
03077     request.data_size = data_size;
03078     ec_soe_request_write(&request);
03079 
03080     if (down_interruptible(&master->master_sem)) {
03081         ec_soe_request_clear(&request);
03082         return -EINTR;
03083     }
03084 
03085     if (!(slave = ec_master_find_slave(master, 0, slave_position))) {
03086         up(&master->master_sem);
03087         EC_MASTER_ERR(master, "Slave %u does not exist!\n",
03088                 slave_position);
03089         ec_soe_request_clear(&request);
03090         return -EINVAL;
03091     }
03092 
03093     EC_SLAVE_DBG(slave, 1, "Scheduling SoE write request.\n");
03094 
03095     // schedule SoE write request.
03096     list_add_tail(&request.list, &slave->soe_requests);
03097 
03098     up(&master->master_sem);
03099 
03100     // wait for processing through FSM
03101     if (wait_event_interruptible(master->request_queue,
03102                 request.state != EC_INT_REQUEST_QUEUED)) {
03103         // interrupted by signal
03104         down(&master->master_sem);
03105         if (request.state == EC_INT_REQUEST_QUEUED) {
03106             // abort request
03107             list_del(&request.list);
03108             up(&master->master_sem);
03109             ec_soe_request_clear(&request);
03110             return -EINTR;
03111         }
03112         up(&master->master_sem);
03113     }
03114 
03115     // wait until master FSM has finished processing
03116     wait_event(master->request_queue, request.state != EC_INT_REQUEST_BUSY);
03117 
03118     if (error_code) {
03119         *error_code = request.error_code;
03120     }
03121     ret = request.state == EC_INT_REQUEST_SUCCESS ? 0 : -EIO;
03122     ec_soe_request_clear(&request);
03123 
03124     return ret;
03125 }
03126 
03127 /*****************************************************************************/
03128 
03129 int ecrt_master_read_idn(ec_master_t *master, uint16_t slave_position,
03130         uint8_t drive_no, uint16_t idn, uint8_t *target, size_t target_size,
03131         size_t *result_size, uint16_t *error_code)
03132 {
03133     ec_soe_request_t request;
03134     ec_slave_t *slave;
03135     int ret;
03136 
03137     if (drive_no > 7) {
03138         EC_MASTER_ERR(master, "Invalid drive number!\n");
03139         return -EINVAL;
03140     }
03141 
03142     ec_soe_request_init(&request);
03143     ec_soe_request_set_drive_no(&request, drive_no);
03144     ec_soe_request_set_idn(&request, idn);
03145     ec_soe_request_read(&request);
03146 
03147     if (down_interruptible(&master->master_sem)) {
03148         ec_soe_request_clear(&request);
03149         return -EINTR;
03150     }
03151 
03152     if (!(slave = ec_master_find_slave(master, 0, slave_position))) {
03153         up(&master->master_sem);
03154         ec_soe_request_clear(&request);
03155         EC_MASTER_ERR(master, "Slave %u does not exist!\n", slave_position);
03156         return -EINVAL;
03157     }
03158 
03159     EC_SLAVE_DBG(slave, 1, "Scheduling SoE read request.\n");
03160 
03161     // schedule request.
03162     list_add_tail(&request.list, &slave->soe_requests);
03163 
03164     up(&master->master_sem);
03165 
03166     // wait for processing through FSM
03167     if (wait_event_interruptible(master->request_queue,
03168                 request.state != EC_INT_REQUEST_QUEUED)) {
03169         // interrupted by signal
03170         down(&master->master_sem);
03171         if (request.state == EC_INT_REQUEST_QUEUED) {
03172             list_del(&request.list);
03173             up(&master->master_sem);
03174             ec_soe_request_clear(&request);
03175             return -EINTR;
03176         }
03177         // request already processing: interrupt not possible.
03178         up(&master->master_sem);
03179     }
03180 
03181     // wait until master FSM has finished processing
03182     wait_event(master->request_queue, request.state != EC_INT_REQUEST_BUSY);
03183 
03184     if (error_code) {
03185         *error_code = request.error_code;
03186     }
03187 
03188     if (request.state != EC_INT_REQUEST_SUCCESS) {
03189         if (result_size) {
03190             *result_size = 0;
03191         }
03192         ret = -EIO;
03193     } else { // success
03194         if (request.data_size > target_size) {
03195             EC_MASTER_ERR(master, "Buffer too small.\n");
03196             ret = -EOVERFLOW;
03197         }
03198         else { // data fits in buffer
03199             if (result_size) {
03200                 *result_size = request.data_size;
03201             }
03202             memcpy(target, request.data, request.data_size);
03203             ret = 0;
03204         }
03205     }
03206 
03207     ec_soe_request_clear(&request);
03208     return ret;
03209 }
03210 
03211 /*****************************************************************************/
03212 
03213 void ecrt_master_reset(ec_master_t *master)
03214 {
03215     ec_slave_config_t *sc;
03216 
03217     list_for_each_entry(sc, &master->configs, list) {
03218         if (sc->slave) {
03219             ec_slave_request_state(sc->slave, EC_SLAVE_STATE_OP);
03220         }
03221     }
03222 }
